summary: Build a one-page marketing website for 'Sarah Legal' featuring Sarah as the face of the company, describing legal help areas, and an Active Lawsuits section (without the Free Case Review section/form or the 3-step intake process).
architectural_notes: User-requested palette update: use USA-themed accents Red #e5383b and Blue #00296b (overrides prior 'avoid blue/purple' styling guidance).
Use the red accent (#e5383b) prominently for primary buttons/CTAs (e.g., make buttons red).
known_issues: Sarah's image is still missing/not displayed on the page (should be included in the Hero per requirements).
Removing the Free Case Review section requires updating/repurposing any existing 'Start your free case review' CTAs (e.g., in Active Lawsuits) that currently scroll to the removed section.

existing_features.title: Create a one-page public marketing website for “Sarah Legal” with clear sections: Hero (featuring Sarah as the face of the company), Practice Areas, How It Works (3 steps), Free Case Review (short intake form), and Footer (contact + disclaimers).
Add content describing that Sarah Legal (Sarah Justice) offers free help for people affected by: Personal Injury, Product Liability, Dangerous Drugs, Medical Devices, and Sexual Abuse.

Implement a “How It Works” 3-step process section that matches the described flow: (1) Free Case Review (short form) to see if the case could qualify for possible compensation, (2) an agent reaches out to confirm eligibility, (3) a document is sent for signature and the firm fights for maximum compensation with no upfront costs.
Add a “Free Case Review” short form that collects enough information to assess whether a visitor’s case could qualify, and provide a clear success confirmation after submission.
Wire the frontend form submission to the backend create endpoint using the existing actor pattern and React Query, including loading and error states.

Apply a cohesive, distinctive visual theme appropriate for a legal-aid landing page, using a warm neutral palette with a deep green accent (avoid blue/purple), consistent typography, and clean section spacing; ensure mobile-first layout and accessibility.
Add Sarah’s provided image as a static frontend asset and use it in the Hero section (and optionally in an “About Sarah” block) without routing images through the backend.

Ensure Sarah’s provided photo is included as a static frontend asset and is visibly rendered in the Hero section, replacing the current placeholder (scale icon + gradient card) while keeping the existing hero layout responsive and accessible (proper alt text, no layout shift). Do not route the image through the backend.

Add a new landing page section titled “Active Lawsuits” that lists the following lawsuits: Paraquat Lawsuit; Bard Powerport Lawsuit; Rideshare Lawsuit; Social Media Addiction Lawsuit; Online Gambling Addiction Lawsuit; LDS Church Abuse Lawsuit; Depo Provera Lawsuit. Each lawsuit item must include a visible button labeled “Start your free case review” that scrolls the user to the Free Case Review form section (id="free-case-review") with smooth behavior.

Add smooth, performance-friendly scroll/reveal animations across the one-page site to make the website feel more alive, while respecting accessibility preferences (reduced motion) and avoiding janky/expensive animations. Apply these animations to major sections (Hero, Practice Areas, Active Lawsuits, How It Works, Free Case Review) so content subtly animates into view as the user scrolls.

Update the site’s theme color tokens so the primary/accent styling reflects a USA-inspired palette using Blue #00296b and Red #e5383b (convert these hex values to the OKLCH values used by the Tailwind/CSS-variable theme). Apply this to both light and dark mode variables in the active global stylesheet so buttons, links, and key highlights render with the new palette.

Audit the landing page sections (Hero, Practice Areas, Active Lawsuits, How It Works, Free Case Review, Footer) to ensure any hard-coded green/beige accent styling is replaced by theme tokens (primary/accent) so the USA palette is applied consistently across CTAs, links, badges, and decorative accents.

Update the landing page primary call-to-action buttons to use the red accent color (theme token `accent`, currently based on #e5383b) for their background/hover states instead of the blue `primary` token, so the most important buttons render red across the site while preserving accessibility and dark mode contrast.
Remove the “Free Case Review” section from the landing page so it is no longer rendered and the page no longer contains a section with id="free-case-review".

Update all navigation links and call-to-action buttons that currently scroll to the removed "free-case-review" section so they instead scroll to a remaining section (use a dedicated "Contact" target anchored near the footer). Replace user-facing CTA text that mentions “free case review” with equivalent consultation/contact wording in English.
Update any remaining page copy that references submitting or completing a “case review form” so it does not imply the existence of a form on the site.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a one-page website for 'Sarah Legal' using the attached image of Sarah as the primary hero/branding element.
Add content sections describing free help for: Personal Injury, Product Liability, Dangerous Drugs, Medical Devices, and Sexual Abuse.
Add smooth scroll/section reveal animations to make the one-page site feel more alive while keeping performance/accessibility in mind.
Update the site accent color scheme to a USA vibe using Red #e5383b and Blue #00296b.
